summary: The Army spends over $20 billion annually developing and procuring weapons—such as tanks and helicopters. Prior to procurement, the Army establishes "requirements" for these weapons—key characteristics—to help guide the process. In the past, the Army cancelled systems because these requirements would not be met. Although we found that the Army has taken steps to improve how it develops requirements, it is still unable to ensure...
title: Army Weapon System Requirements: Need to Address Workforce Shortfalls to Make Necessary Improvements
